The 26-year-old spent time with the Cowboys from 2020-2024 but has yet to make his regular-season NFL debut.
injuries.shortComment: Alarcon was handed a six-game suspension Wednesday for violating the NFL's performance-enhancing substances policy, Matt Maiocco of NBC Sports Bay Area reports.

injuries.longComment: out
injuries.shortComment: out

injuries.longComment: Rourke played his entire final season at Indiana on a torn ACL but managed to throw for 3,042 yards, 29 touchdowns and five interceptions through 12 games, vaulting the Hoosiers to the College Football Playoff. He underwent surgery Jan. 8 and was subsequently drafted in the seventh round by the 49ers. Due to his recovery, he didn't participate in rookie camp or training camp, and he'll be required to miss at least four games due to his placement on the NFI list. The 49ers can take their time with his recovery as long as Brock Purdy and Mac Jones (knee) are upright, as Rourke projects for the No. 3 role upon return.
injuries.shortComment: Rourke (knee) was placed on the reserve/non-football injury list Tuesday.

injuries.longComment: Kittle will miss at least the next four games before potentially returning to action Week 6 versus the Buccaneers. Before departing Sunday's 17-13 win over the Seahawks with a hamstring injury, Kittle produced four catches for 25 yards and a touchdown on four targets over just 20 snaps. Luke Farrell and Jake Tonges are left as the only healthy tight ends on the 49ers' roster, though fullback Kyle Juszczyk is also an option to take on some of Kittle's pass-catching duties. San Francisco could also elevate Brayden Willis from the practice squad to bolster the depth of the group.
injuries.shortComment: The 49ers placed Kittle (hamstring) on injured reserve Tuesday.

injuries.longComment: Taylor suffered the injury during the 49ers' preseason game against the Raiders. He was already slated to miss the entire 2025 season after being placed on injured reserve, and the 27-year-old running back will aim to return for the 2026 campaign once he's fully recovered from the procedure.
injuries.shortComment: Taylor will undergo season-ending surgery to repair a fracture in his shoulder, Nick Wagoner of ESPN.com reports.

injuries.longComment: Juszczyk was evaluated on the sidelines after taking a hit to the head in the first half of Sunday's game, and the veteran fullback has been diagnosed with a concussion. He will not be allowed to return to Sunday's game, and he'll have to pass the league's five-step concussion protocol in order to play in Week 3 against the Cardinals on Sunday, Sept. 21. Juszczyk is the only fullback on the 49ers' active roster, but tight ends Luke Farrell, Jake Tonges or Brayden Willis could be deployed as a backfield blocker for the rest of Sunday's contest.
injuries.shortComment: Juszczyk has been ruled out for the rest of Sunday's game against the Saints due to a concussion, Jennifer Lee Chan of NBC Sports Bay Area reports.

injuries.longComment: Cowart missed all three of the Jets' preseason games due to an ankle injury that he suffered during training camp practice in early August. By being placed on IR prior to Tuesday's 4 p.m. ET roster cut deadline, Cowart will be forced to miss the entire 2025 season unless he reaches an injury settlement with the Jets. The 2019 fifth-round pick appeared in 15 regular-season games (including seven starts) for the Bears last year and posted 26 tackles (14 solo), including 2.5 sacks.
injuries.shortComment: The Jets placed Cowart (ankle) on injured reserve Tuesday, Randy Lange and Eric Allen of the team's official site reports.

injuries.longComment: questionable
injuries.shortComment: questionable

injuries.longComment: Johnson was evaluated for an ankle injury in the first half, and the injury is severe enough for him to be ruled out for the rest of Sunday's contest. Micheal Clemons will see an uptick in playing time the rest of the way due to Johnson's injury.
injuries.shortComment: Johnson (ankle) has been ruled out for the rest of Sunday's game against the Cowboys.

injuries.longComment: The severity and nature of Weston's injury isn't clear, but he'll start the campaign on IR and be forced to miss at least the first four games of the season. That makes Week 5 against the Cowboys on Sunday, Oct. 5 the first opportunity for Weston to make his NFL regular-season debut.
injuries.shortComment: The Jets placed Weston (undisclosed) on injured reserve Tuesday with a designation to return, Randy Lange and Eric Allen of the team's official site reports.

injuries.longComment: Boyd suffered a shoulder injury during practice in early August, and the issue is serious enough to result in the cornerback being placed on season-ending IR. After signing with New York in mid-March, Boyd had been slated to work as a backup in the secondary as well as serve as a core special-teamer.
injuries.shortComment: The Jets placed Boyd (shoulder) on injured reserve Monday.

injuries.longComment: Adams was forced to leave in the first half of Sunday's game due to a groin injury, which is severe enough for him to be ruled out the rest of the way. Malachi Moore and Isaiah Oliver are candidates to work with the Jets' first-team defense alongside Andre Cisco at safety due to Adams' injury.
injuries.shortComment: Adams (groin) has been ruled out for the rest of Sunday's game against Buffalo.

injuries.longComment: Adams was forced to leave in the first half of Sunday's game due to a groin injury, which is severe enough for him to be ruled out the rest of the way. Malachi Moore and Isaiah Oliver are candidates to work with the Jets' first-team defense alongside Andre Cisco at safety due to Adams' injury.
injuries.shortComment: Adams (groin) has been ruled out for the rest of Sunday's game against Buffalo.

injuries.longComment: The starting corner made two solo tackles before leaving the contest. Carter finished with four tackles (three solo) and a pass breakup on 36 defensive snaps in the Jets' Week 1 loss to the Steelers. Korie Black, Qwan'tez Stiggers and Azareye'h Thomas are New York's extra corners for Sunday's game.
injuries.shortComment: Carter has a shoulder injury and is questionable to return to Sunday's matchup with the Bills.

injuries.longComment: questionable
injuries.shortComment: questionable

injuries.longComment: Charles will be required to miss a minimum of four games to start the 2025 season after being placed on the reserve/PUP list. The 28-year-old wideout tore his ACL in Week 14 last season and is not ready to return to the field as he continues to recover.
injuries.shortComment: The Jets placed Charles (knee) on the reserve/PUP list Tuesday.

injuries.longComment: questionable
injuries.shortComment: questionable

injuries.longComment: Hartwig was waived with an injury designation Tuesday. He signed with the Jets as an undrafted free agent out of Purdue earlier this year.
injuries.shortComment: Hartwig (undisclosed) reverted to the Jets' injured-reserve list Wednesday, Aaron Wilson of KPRC 2 Houston reports.

injuries.longComment: Vera-Tucker was ruled out for the season Thursday, so this move was a formality to free up a roster spot. The Jets haven't confirmed their plans to replace Vera-Tucker at right guard, but Joe Tippmann could shift over, with Josh Myers taking Tippmann's spot at center.
injuries.shortComment: Vera-Tucker (triceps) was placed on injured reserve Saturday, Rich Cimini of ESPN.com reports.

injuries.longComment: Before his departure from the Jets' 30-10 loss, Fields completed three of 11 pass attempts for 27 yards and added five carries for 49 yards. With the QB's concussion confirmed by the Jets, per Cimini, Fields now will have to progress through the NFL's protocol for head injuries in order to play next weekend against the Buccaneers. If Fields isn't cleared for Week 3 action, Tyrod Taylor would be in line to start in his place.
injuries.shortComment: Fields sustained a concussion during Sunday's game against the Bills, Rich Cimini of ESPN.com and Ralph Vacchiano of Fox Sports report.

injuries.longComment: questionable
injuries.shortComment: questionable

injuries.longComment: Hoecht and fellow free-agent signing Larry Ogunjobi will both miss the first six regular-season games of the 2025 campaign due to suspension, a development that hurts Buffalo's defensive-line rotation. With Hoecht unavailable to kick off the coming season, the Bills may be motivated to pursue additional depth behind Greg Rousseau and A.J. Epenesa.
injuries.shortComment: Bills general manager Brandon Beane said Friday that Hoecht has received a six-game suspension for violation of the NFL's policy regarding performance-enhancing substances, Matt Parrino of The Syracuse Post-Standard reports.

injuries.longComment: Oliver missed last week's win over the Jets with his ankle injury and is now trending towards missing a second straight game. If he ends up being unable to play, Deone Walker and T.J. Sanders would likely see increased playing time at defensive tackle alongside DaQuan Jones.
injuries.shortComment: Oliver (ankle) is unlikely to play in Buffalo's matchup versus the Dolphins on Thursday, Joe Schad of The Palm Beach Post reports.

injuries.longComment: Ogunjobi is fresh off signing a one-year deal with Buffalo, but his six-game suspension could make it more difficult for the veteran defensive lineman to challenge  DaQuan Jones for a starting spot next to Ed Oliver. Across 15 regular-season appearances with Pittsburgh in 2024, he tallied 41 tackles (16 solo) and 1.5 sacks.
injuries.shortComment: Ogunjobi has been suspended the first six regular-season games of the 2025 season for violation of the league's policy regarding performance-enhancing substances, Matt Parrino of The Syracuse Post-Standard reports.

injuries.longComment: Carter will miss the entire 2025 season due to a torn Achilles suffered in late August. The 2024 third-round pick's focus will now fully turn to his rehab, with the goal of making a recovery in time for the beginning of training camp next season.
injuries.shortComment: The Bills placed Carter (Achilles) on injured reserve Thursday.

injuries.longComment: Milano is trending in the wrong direction after missing practice the past two days due to a the pectoral injury he suffered during the team's Week 2 win versus the Jets. With Shaq Thompson (hamstring) dealing with an injury as well, Joe Andreessen could be in line for an increased workload Thursday if Milano can't play.
injuries.shortComment: Milano (pectoral) isn't expected to play in Buffalo's matchup versus the Dolphins on Thursday, Joe Schad of The Palm Beach Post reports.

injuries.longComment: questionable
injuries.shortComment: questionable

injuries.longComment: The rookie first-round pick will be eligible to return Week 5 versus the Patriots , as he's recovering from an LCL sprain in his right knee that he picked up in late July. Hairston was a potential starter, but with limited training camp reps he may need additional time to ramp up even once he's medically cleared. Tre'Davious White (lower leg) is expected to start opposite Christian Benford if the former is healthy.
injuries.shortComment: Hairston (knee) was placed on injured reserve Tuesday.

injuries.longComment: questionable
injuries.shortComment: questionable

injuries.longComment: Owens was waived with an injury designation Saturday and then went unclaimed on waivers. The safety will now need to miss the 2025 campaign unless he reaches an injury settlement with Buffalo. The New Hampshire product signed with the Bills as an undrafted free agent in May.
injuries.shortComment: Owens (undisclosed) reverted to the Bills' injured reserve list Wednesday, Alaina Getzenberg of ESPN.com reports.

injuries.longComment: questionable
injuries.shortComment: questionable

injuries.longComment: questionable
injuries.shortComment: questionable

injuries.longComment: Bass dealt with what at the time was termed a pelvic injury in the early days of training camp but still was able to suit up in Buffalo's preseason finale, connecting on three of four field-goal attempts and both point-after tries. He then mustered just one limited practice during Week 1 prep due to left hip and groin concerns before the team made the decision to shut him down for at least the first four games of the season. The Bills will need to elevate Matt Prater from the practice squad to the active roster ahead of Sunday night's showdown with the Ravens.
injuries.shortComment: The Bills placed Bass (left hip/groin) on injured reserve Friday.

injuries.longComment: Grable has been in concussion protocol since since early August, and he will now be sidelined for at least four games to open the season. Ryan Van Demark and Chase Lundt stand to operate as the top reserves at offensive tackle in Grable's absence.
injuries.shortComment: Grable (concussion) was placed on injured reserve with a designation to return Tuesday.

injuries.longComment: Davis was waived with an injury designation Tuesday, and he's now set to miss the entirety of the 2025 campaign while on IR with an undisclosed injury. The defensive tackle would be eligible to play again this season if he were to reach an injury settlement with Pittsburgh, otherwise he'll shift his focus to 2026.
injuries.shortComment: Davis (undisclosed) reverted to injured reserve with the Steelers on Wednesday, Alan Saunders of SteelersNow.com reports.

injuries.longComment: questionable
injuries.shortComment: questionable

injuries.longComment: Loudermilk was spotted in a walking boot after the loss. He played just six defensive snaps before going down with the injury. Loudermilk has yet to record any stats in the box score across 37 defensive snaps this season. With Derrick Harmon (knee) already dealing with an injury of his own and Dean Lowry (knee) out for the season, Pittsburgh's defensive line depth has taken a major hit.
injuries.shortComment: Loudermilk is expected to miss multiple weeks after sustaining a high-ankle sprain in Sunday's loss to the Seahawks, Brooke Pryor of ESPN.com reports.

injuries.longComment: Lowry was in the mix for a roster spot as a depth option along the Steelers' defensive line. He'll now be lost for the season, though the details of the injury remain unclear.
injuries.shortComment: Lowry was placed on injured reserve due to a knee injury Saturday, Ray Fittipaldo of the Pittsburgh Post-Gazette reports.

injuries.longComment: ir
injuries.shortComment: ir

injuries.longComment: Head coach Mike Tomlin told reporters Tuesday that Harrison wouldn't be available for Pittsburgh's Week 2 contest against the Seahawks, but following his placement on the injured reserve list, he'll be forced to miss the team's next four games. The Ohio State product played 20 total snaps (four defensive and 16 on special teams) and recorded two total tackles before sustaining a knee injury in the Steelers' Week 1 win over the Jets. Carson Bruener could see increased snaps as a rotational inside linebacker while Harrison remains sidelined.
injuries.shortComment: Harrison (knee) was placed on injured reserve Wednesday, Teresa Varley of the Steelers' official site reports.

injuries.longComment: Highsmith suffered a high-ankle sprain during the Steelers' 31-17 loss to the Seahawks this past Sunday. High-ankle sprains typically mean a multi-week absence, though it appears his injury isn't that severe as Tomlin relayed Monday that the 2020 third-rounder is not expected to spend time on injured reserve, per Ian Rapoport of NFL Network. Nick Herbig will likely step into a starting role opposite T.J. Watt and Jack Sawyer should see an uptick in defensive snaps in a rotational edge role for as long as Highsmith is sidelined. Highsmith's next opportunity to suit up is Week 4 against the Vikings on Sunday, Sept. 28.
injuries.shortComment: Head coach Mike Tomlin told reporters Tuesday that Highsmith (ankle) has been ruled out for Sunday's game against the Patriots, Gerry Dulac of the Pittsburgh Post-Gazette reports.

injuries.longComment: Trice has been sidelined with a hamstring injury since Aug. 1 and has been prone to lower-body injuries throughout his pro career. He was designated to return, meaning he will be sidelined for at least the first four games of the 2025 season.
injuries.shortComment: Trice (hamstring) was placed on injured reserve Tuesday, Teresa Varley of Steelers.com reports.

injuries.longComment: questionable
injuries.shortComment: questionable

injuries.longComment: questionable
injuries.shortComment: questionable

injuries.longComment: Kent was sidelined for the majority of training camp due to a right foot injury, per Josh Carney of Steelers Depot. Kent will be required to miss at least the first four games of the regular season, making Week 6 against the Browns on Sunday, Oct. 12 the rookie seventh-rounder's first opportunity to make his NFL debut.
injuries.shortComment: The Steelers placed Kent on injured reserve Thursday due to a foot injury, Teresa Varley of the team's official site reports.

injuries.longComment: Warren is now set to remain with the team after clearing waivers, albeit on injured reserve. The rookie undrafted free agent will now be forced to miss the entirety of the upcoming campaign unless he's waived with an injury settlement.
injuries.shortComment: Warren (concussion) reverted to Pittsburgh's injured reserve Wednesday, Alan Saunders of SteelersNow.com reports.

injuries.longComment: Howard will have to miss at least the first four games of the regular season as he works his way back from a fractured bone in his left hand suffered during practice Aug. 5. That injury caused him to miss the entire preseason. Once healthy, the rookie sixth-round pick figures to operate as Pittsburgh's emergency No. 3 quarterback behind Aaron Rodgers and Mason Rudolph.
injuries.shortComment: The Steelers placed Howard (hand) on injured reserve Thursday, Teresa Varley of the team's official site reports.

injuries.longComment: Thompson popped up on the Steelers' injury report with a hamstring injury prior to their Week 1 win over the Jets, and the issue now appears serious enough for him to land on IR. Pittsburgh's emergency third quarterback will now miss at least four games, with his earliest possible return coming in Week 7 against the Bengals. With rookie Will Howard (hand) also on IR, the Steelers' quarterback room now consists of just Aaron Rodgers and Mason Rudolph.
injuries.shortComment: Thompson (hamstring) was placed on injured reserve Wednesday, Teresa Varley of the Steelers' official site reports.

injuries.longComment: The tight end tore his Achilles during OTAs on Tuesday, but this move confirms that he's out for the season. Parham signed with the Steelers in February, spent most of 2024 on Denver's practice squad and last caught an NFL pass in 2023 with the Chargers. That was also his best season, when he grabbed 27 passes for 285 yards and four scores.
injuries.shortComment: Parham (Achilles) was placed on injured reserve by the Steelers on Thursday, Mike DeFabo of The Athletic reports.

injuries.longComment: Hankins will miss the first four games of the regular season as a result of this move. The veteran defensive tackle saw significant playing time on the interior of Seattle's defensive line last season, accruing 30 tackles (15 solo) in 17 games.
injuries.shortComment: Hankins (back) was moved to the reserve/non-football injury list Tuesday, John Boyle of the Seahawks' official site reports.

injuries.longComment: Mills will be sidelined for the first four games of the regular season as he continues to recover from an ACL injury in his right knee suffered during his final season of college football at Notre Dame. Once healthy, the rookie fifth-round pick will likely work in a rotational role along Seattle's defensive line.
injuries.shortComment: Mills (knee) was moved to the reserve/non-football injury list Tuesday, John Boyle of the Seahawks' official site reports.

injuries.longComment: questionable
injuries.shortComment: questionable

injuries.longComment: Finley was injured in practice over the weekend and will now spend the 2025 campaign on injured reserve unless he's cut with an injury settlement at a later date. Finley has appeared in 26 regular-season games with the Chargers and Seahawks over the last two seasons.
injuries.shortComment: The Seahawks placed Finley (knee) on injured reserve Monday, Corbin K. Smith of SI.com reports.

injuries.longComment: Witherspoon suffered the injury during the Seahawks' Week 1 loss to the 49ers, and his practice participation over the coming week will help determine his availability for Week 3. Derion Kendrick ended up seeing a significant increase in defensive snaps during the Seahawks' 31-17 win over the Steelers on Sunday, and he took advantage of the opportunity with a solo tackle and two pass defenses (including an interception). Kendrick will continue to see a bigger role in the Seahawks' defense for as long as Witherspoon is sidelined.
injuries.shortComment: Witherspoon is dealing with an MCL contusion to his knee, and head coach Mike Macdonald said Monday that it's "possible" that the 2023 first-rounder could return for the Seahawks' Week 3 clash against the Saints on Sunday, Michael-Shawn Dugar of The Athletic reports.

injuries.longComment: Haynes was dealing with a pectoral injury throughout training camp, and he will now be forced to miss at least four contests to begin the 2025 season. In his absence, Jalen Sundell, Mason Richman and Bryce Cabeldue are lined up to operate as Seattle's reserve options at interior offensive line.
injuries.shortComment: Haynes (pectoral) was placed on injured reserve with a designation to return Tuesday, John Boyle of the Seahawks' official website reports.

injuries.longComment: McIntosh was trying to defend his role from last year as the team's No. 3 running back, but his season will end before it started due to an ACL tear in the opening days of training camp. Damien Martinez and George Holani are now the favorites for the No. 3 job behind Kenneth Walker and Zach Charbonnet.
injuries.shortComment: The Seahawks placed McIntosh (knee) on injured reserve Monday, Curtis Crabtree of Fox 13 Seattle reports.

injuries.longComment: The veteran edge rusher sustained his hamstring injury early into Sunday's blowout win, playing just 12 defensive snaps and recording one total tackle before exiting. Van Noy had the best season of his 12-year career in 2024, recording 41 total tackles, including a team-leading 12.5 sacks, two passes defended and two forced fumbles over 16 regular-season contests. If the 34-year-old is forced to miss multiple weeks, 2025 second-round pick Mike Green is expected to start opposite Odafe Oweh as part of Baltimore's top edge-rush duo.
injuries.shortComment: Van Noy is bracing to potentially miss multiple weeks after sustaining a hamstring injury in Sunday's 41-17 win over the Browns, Jeremy Fowler of ESPN.com reports.

injuries.longComment: Isaac was already expected to miss half of the 2025 season after dislocating his elbow during the Ravens' second preseason game at Dallas, but it's now certain he'll have to miss at least the first four games of the year. He was designated for return by Baltimore, which means he'll be allowed to play once healthy starting in Week 5 versus the Texans. Until he returns, rookie second-rounder Mike Green projects to see a higher share of snaps on the edge.
injuries.shortComment: Baltimore placed Isaac (elbow) on its injured reserve list Tuesday, Jamison Hensley of ESPN.com reports.

injuries.longComment: Washington is recovering from a torn Achilles that he suffered in May, but there's optimism that he could be fully healthy late in the regular season. He played in all 17 regular-season games for the Ravens in 2024 and finished with career highs in defensive snaps (677), tackles (64), pass defenses (eight) and interceptions (two).
injuries.shortComment: The Ravens placed Washington (Achilles) on the reserve/PUP list Tuesday, Jamison Hensley of ESPN.com reports.

injuries.longComment: Kone tore a ligament in his left knee during the Ravens' preseason game against the Colts, and he will miss the entire 2025 season as a result. With Kone out for 2025, the Ravens bolstered their depth at cornerback by signing M.J. Devonshire.
injuries.shortComment: The Ravens placed Kone (knee) on injured reserve Saturday.

injuries.longComment: Humphrey went to the locker room during the fourth quarter to undergo further tests to determine the severity of his groin injury. Keyon Martin and T.J. Tampa are candidates to see more work out of the slot corner if Humphrey is unable to return.
injuries.shortComment: Humphrey is questionable to return to Sunday's game against the Browns due to a groin injury, Brian Wacker of The Baltimore Sun reports.

injuries.longComment: Longerbeam didn't play in Thursday's preseason opener against the Colts and will now miss the 2025 season. He was a sixth-round pick out of Rutgers back in April.
injuries.shortComment: The Ravens placed Longerbeam (knee) on injured reserve Sunday, Jamison Hensley of ESPN.com reports.

injuries.longComment: Wade underwent surgery to repair a rib injury that he suffered during the Ravens' preseason finale against the Commanders on Saturday. The 24-year-old wideout will focus on rehab and recovery and aim to be fully healthy for OTAs and minicamp in the spring.
injuries.shortComment: The Ravens placed Wade (ribs) on injured reserve Tuesday, Jamison Hensley of ESPN.com reports.

injuries.longComment: The running back and special-teams asset was evaluated for a possible concussion during the first quarter. Ali recorded one solo tackle before exiting. Justice Hill is next in line to take over his kickoff-return duties.
injuries.shortComment: Ali (concussion) is out for the rest of Sunday's game against the Browns, Brian Wacker of The Baltimore Sun reports.

injuries.longComment: Wade underwent surgery to repair a rib injury that he suffered during the Ravens' preseason finale against the Commanders on Saturday. The 24-year-old wideout will focus on rehab and recovery and aim to be fully healthy for OTAs and minicamp in the spring.
injuries.shortComment: The Ravens placed Wade (ribs) on injured reserve Tuesday, Jamison Hensley of ESPN.com reports.

injuries.longComment: Jones underwent shoulder surgery a week after the NFL Combine, according to Jeff Zrebiec of The Athletic. The rookie third-round pick out of LSU is now guaranteed to miss the first four games of the season. Daniel Faalele is expected to start at right guard to begin the season, and it's unclear if Jones will usurp him upon return.
injuries.shortComment: Jones (shoulder) was placed on the reserve/non-football injury list Tuesday, Jamison Hensley of ESPN.com reports.

injuries.longComment: questionable
injuries.shortComment: questionable

injuries.longComment: The running back and special-teams asset was evaluated for a possible concussion during the first quarter. Ali recorded one solo tackle before exiting. Justice Hill is next in line to take over his kickoff-return duties.
injuries.shortComment: Ali (concussion) is out for the rest of Sunday's game against the Browns, Brian Wacker of The Baltimore Sun reports.

injuries.longComment: Ricard has been sidelined for the past month and hasn't played in either of the Ravens' first two regular-season contests.
injuries.shortComment: Coach John Harbaugh said Ricard's (calf) recovery has been slower than the Ravens had hoped, and he's considered week-to-week, Jeff Zrebiec of The Athletic reports.

injuries.longComment: questionable
injuries.shortComment: questionable

injuries.longComment: The 2021 second-round pick from Notre Dame missed the Browns' final nine games in 2024 due to a neck injury, and it now appears he'll miss all of 2025 as he continues to recover. Owusu-Koramoah has been one of Cleveland's most impactful defenders over the past two seasons, recording 162 total tackles, including 6.5 sacks, nine passes defended and two forced fumbles across 24 regular-season games. With the 25-year-old expected to be sidelined for the entire season, 2019 first-round pick Devin Bush is projected to step in and serve as one of the Browns' top insider linebackers.
injuries.shortComment: The Browns placed Owusu-Koramoah (neck) on the Reserve/Physically Unable to to Perform list Monday.

injuries.longComment: Watson sustained a biceps injury in Wednesday's practice, per head coach Kevin Stefanski. The linebacker will miss the entire 2025 season.
injuries.shortComment: Watson (biceps) was placed on injured reserve Thursday.

injuries.longComment: After playing 16 games with the Browns as an undrafted rookie in 2024, Reid made the team again in 2025 but will miss at least the first four games of the year. His primary utility will be on special teams once he returns.
injuries.shortComment: Reid (back) was placed on injured reserve Tuesday.

injuries.longComment: Kendall wasn't claimed by another team after the Browns waived him with an injury designation Tuesday, so now he's headed to their injured reserve list. He'll stay there for the whole season unless he can work out an injury settlement with the club.
injuries.shortComment: Kendall (undisclosed) reverted to Cleveland's injured reserve list Wednesday, Aaron Wilson of KPRC 2 Houston reports.

injuries.longComment: After leaving practice on a cart Tuesday following a non-contact injury, Emerson will be out for the season with a ruptured Achilles, head coach Kevin Stefanski confirmed Wednesday. The 24-year-old appeared in all 17 games last season, starting 15 and tallying 80 tackles. Greg Newsome, who normally plays nickel corner, is now expected to take Emerson's spot in base defense alongside Denzel Ward.
injuries.shortComment: Emerson (Achilles) was ruled out for the season Wednesday, Mary Kay Cabot of The Cleveland Plain Dealer reports.

injuries.longComment: Carter went to the locker room in the first quarter after taking a hit to the head and has been diagnosed with a concussion. He is now in the league's concussion protocol, which he will have to clear in order to play against the Packers in Week 3. Isaiah Bond fielded a punt return in the first quarter and figures to serve as the Browns' returner on special teams for the rest of Sunday's game in Carter's absence.
injuries.shortComment: Carter (concussion) has been ruled out for the rest of Sunday's game against the Ravens.

injuries.longComment: Carter went to the locker room in the first quarter after taking a hit to the head and has been diagnosed with a concussion. He is now in the league's concussion protocol, which he will have to clear in order to play against the Packers in Week 3. Isaiah Bond fielded a punt return in the first quarter and figures to serve as the Browns' returner on special teams for the rest of Sunday's game in Carter's absence.
injuries.shortComment: Carter (concussion) has been ruled out for the rest of Sunday's game against the Ravens.

injuries.longComment: McDonald impressed at Browns' rookie minicamp and stuck with the team through the summer and played all three preseason games, finishing with two receptions for 11 yards and a touchdown. The 24-year-old receiver will spend the rest of the season on injured reserve unless he reaches an injury settlement with the team.
injuries.shortComment: McDonald (undisclosed) cleared waivers Wednesday and reverted to injured reserve, per the NFL's official media site.

injuries.longComment: Carter went to the locker room in the first quarter after taking a hit to the head and has been diagnosed with a concussion. He is now in the league's concussion protocol, which he will have to clear in order to play against the Packers in Week 3. Isaiah Bond fielded a punt return in the first quarter and figures to serve as the Browns' returner on special teams for the rest of Sunday's game in Carter's absence.
injuries.shortComment: Carter (concussion) has been ruled out for the rest of Sunday's game against the Ravens.

injuries.longComment: Bell's placement on the reserve/NFI list will force him to miss at least the first four games of the regular season. A dislocated hip suffered mid-September of last year forced him to spend all but one game of the 2024 campaign on IR, but it remains to be seen whether it's the same issue that has held him out of team activities this offseason. A timetable for his expected return remains undisclosed.
injuries.shortComment: The Browns placed Bell (hip) on the reserve/non-football injury list Tuesday, Kelsey Russo of the team's official site reports.

injuries.longComment: Osborne will remain with the Browns after having gone unclaimed on waivers. He signed with the team as an undrafted free agent earlier in the offseason and will now shift his focus to getting healthy for the 2026 campaign.
injuries.shortComment: Osborne (undisclosed) reverted to Cleveland's injured reserve Tuesday.

injuries.longComment: questionable
injuries.shortComment: questionable

injuries.longComment: Watson will have to miss at least the first four games of the regular season as a result of the transaction, although it wouldn't be a surprise if he stayed on the PUP list as long as possible so the team can avoid further crowding its QB room. He spent all of training camp and the preseason sidelined after undergoing a second Achilles surgery in January. The Browns will open the 2025 campaign with Joe Flacco starting under center and rookies Dillon Gabriel and Shedeur Sanders behind him on the depth chart.
injuries.shortComment: The Browns placed Watson (Achilles) on the reserve/PUP list Tuesday, Kelsey Russo of the team's official site reports.

injuries.longComment: questionable
injuries.shortComment: questionable

injuries.longComment: Carlies picked up an ankle injury during the Colts' preseason opener against the Ravens, which caused him to miss the team's next two exhibition contests. By being placed on IR, The 2024 fifth-rounder will be forced to miss at least four games, making Week 5 against the Raiders on Sunday, Oct. 5 the earliest he can make his 2025 regular-season debut. Carlies finished his rookie campaign with 36 tackles (24 solo), including 1.0 sacks, and one pass defense across 10 regular-season games.
injuries.shortComment: The Colts placed Carlies (ankle) on injured reserve with a designation to return Tuesday, Amanda Foster of the team's official site reports.

injuries.longComment: The linebacker exited Saturday's preseason game against the Packers with the injury and is expected to be out for the season, per Paul Breti of USA Today. Phillips signed a reserve/future contract with the Colts in January after getting cut by the Texans in August of 2024. The 2020 third-round pick of the Browns last saw regular-season action in 2022, when he made 46 tackles (29 solo) in seven games with the Browns.
injuries.shortComment: Phillips (biceps) was placed on injured reserve by the Colts on Monday.

injuries.longComment: questionable
injuries.shortComment: questionable

injuries.longComment: The safety and seventh-round pick left Saturday's preseason game against the Packers with the injury and is expected to be out for the season, per Paul Breti of USA Today. Wohler got a chance to start that game with Nick Cross (hip) out, and he was projecting as a possible third safety for the Colts before the injury.
injuries.shortComment: Wohler (foot) was put on injured reserve by the Colts on Monday.

injuries.longComment: Jones was already ruled out for Sunday's game versus the Broncos, and now he's guaranteed to miss four games, meaning his first return date will be Oct. 12 versus the Cardinals. Fellow cornerback Charvarius Ward (concussion) has also been ruled out, so Mekhi Blackmon is expected to start at cornerback opposite Xavien Howard while Johnathan Edwards and Chris Lammons mix in Week 2.
injuries.shortComment: Jones (hamstring) was placed on injured reserve Saturday.

injuries.longComment: Walley was diagnosed with a torn ACL on Thursday, effectively ending his rookie season. This move now makes that official. The timing of the injury was particularly unfortunate, as Walley was reportedly contending for a starting role at outside corner.
injuries.shortComment: Walley (knee) was placed  on injured reserve Friday.

injuries.longComment: By being placed on injured reserve, Montgomery will be forced to miss the entire 2025 season unless an injury settlement is reached. He spent the entire 2024 season on the Colts' practice squad but hasn't seen regular-season action since 2023 with Indianapolis, when he caught three passes (on eight targets) for 56 yards and a touchdown across seven games.
injuries.shortComment: The Colts placed Montgomery (undisclosed) on the injured reserve list Wednesday.

injuries.longComment: The offensive tackle fractured his leg in Saturday's preseason game against the Packers and had to be carted off wearing an air cast. Freeland's 2025 season is now over after he played on just 23 offensive snaps in 2024.
injuries.shortComment: Freeland (leg) was placed on injured reserve by the Colts on Monday.

injuries.longComment: The offensive lineman would need to reach an injury settlement with the team to have a chance to play in 2025. Wilson initially signed with the Colts last October and spent a few weeks on the team's practice squad. The former college basketball (and football) player has yet to appear in an NFL game.
injuries.shortComment: Wilson (undisclosed) was placed on injured reserve by the Colts on Monday.

injuries.longComment: questionable
injuries.shortComment: questionable

injuries.longComment: As expected, Ahmed will miss the entire 2025 season after suffering an ankle injury during this past Sunday's training camp practice, when he was on the receiving end of an illegal hip-drop tackle. Ahmed was competing for a spot on the Colts' 53-man roster after spending the 2024 season on Indianapolis' and Miami's practice squads, but he will now shift his focus towards being healthy for the 2026 campaign. Khalil Herbert, Ulysses Bentley and newest addition Nate Noel will have increased opportunities to compete with Tyler Goodson and DJ Giddens for backup running back duties due to Ahmed's injury.
injuries.shortComment: The Colts placed Ahmed (ankle) on injured reserve Friday.

injuries.longComment: Henningsen suffered a torn Achilles during the team's joint practice with the 49ers on Thursday. He will now rehab with the Broncos and attempt to be ready for training camp in 2026.
injuries.shortComment: Henningsen (Achilles) reverted to the Broncos' injured reserve Monday, Chris Tomasson of The Denver Gazette reports.

injuries.longComment: Roach was ruled out for Sunday's game against the Titans on Friday, but he'll now be out for at least the first four games of the season. Roach had a career-best campaign in 2024, so he should have a decent role upon his return.
injuries.shortComment: Roach (calf) was placed on injured reserve Saturday, Aric DiLalla of the Broncos' official site reports.

injuries.longComment: Sanders underwent a surgery on his foot in early August after suffering a torn ligament July 26, and he will now be forced to miss at least four games to open the season. In his absence, Karene Reid and Justin Strnad stand to garner some added reps at inside linebacker.
injuries.shortComment: Sanders (foot) was placed on injured reserve with a designation to return Tuesday, Aric DiLalla of the Broncos' official website reports.

injuries.longComment: questionable
injuries.shortComment: questionable

injuries.longComment: The Missouri product appears unlikely to play for Denver in 2025 because the team can only designate eight players to return from IR over the course of the season. Walker signed with the Broncos in May as an undrafted free agent.
injuries.shortComment: Walker (undisclosed) was placed on injured reserve by the Broncos on Thursday, Aric DiLalla of the team's official site reports.

injuries.longComment: Gargiulo was carted off the field during Saturday's preseason game against the Cardinals with what's now being described as an ACL injury. He was competing for a spot as a backup guard on the team and will now shift his focus to getting healthy for next season.
injuries.shortComment: Head coach Sean Payton announced Tuesday that it was an ACL injury that landed Gargiulo on injured reserve, Aric DiLalla of the Broncos' official site reports.

injuries.longComment: questionable
injuries.shortComment: questionable

injuries.longComment: Burton suffered a hamstring injury during training camp, and he will now be forced to miss the entirety of the 2025 campaign as a result of being on IR. The fullback would be eligible to return to action this season if he reaches an injury settlement with Denver, otherwise he'll shift his focus to 2026.
injuries.shortComment: Burton was placed on injured reserve by the Broncos on Tuesday, Aric DiLalla of the team's official website reports.

injuries.longComment: Collier picked up the injury in the first quarter of the game, and it's severity is currently unknown. PJ Mustipher will likely see increased playing time at defensive tackle in Collier's absence.
injuries.shortComment: Collier (knee) has been ruled out for the remainder of Arizona's matchup versus the Panthers on Sunday, Theo Mackie of The Arizona Republic reports.

injuries.longComment: Nolen has been sidelined since late July with a calf injury, and he will now be forced to miss at least four games to open the season while on the PUP list. The defensive tackle was selected in the first round of the 2025 NFL Draft in April, and once healthy, he'll compete for a starting role on the Cardinals' defensive line.
injuries.shortComment: Nolen (calf) was moved to the reserve/PUP list by the Cardinals on Tuesday, Darren Urban of the team's official website reports.

injuries.longComment: Jones suffered a season-ending triceps injury in Week 3 of the 2024 season, and while he's fully recovered from that injury, he's now working through a knee issue that kept him sidelined for most of training camp. The 2018 third-rounder will be required to miss at least the first four games of the regular season, making Week 5 against the Titans on Sunday, Oct. 5 the earliest he can play.
injuries.shortComment: The Cardinals placed Jones on injured reserve Thursday due to a knee injury, Darren Urban of the team's official site reports.

injuries.longComment: Nichols has been been sidelined since the beginning of training camp while nursing a neck injury. Nichols will now be forced to miss at least the first four games of the 2025 campaign, and in his absence, Dante Stills is a candidate to see an increased workload on the defensive line.
injuries.shortComment: Nichols (neck) was moved to the reserve/PUP list by the the Cardinals on Tuesday, Darren Urban of the team's official website reports.

injuries.longComment: questionable
injuries.shortComment: questionable

injuries.longComment: Russell suffered a concussion at practice in late July, ultimately remaining sidelined throughout the entirety of the preseason. The linebacker is now set to miss the entirety of the 2025 campaign while on IR, unless he's able to reach an injury settlement with the team.
injuries.shortComment: Russell was placed on injured reserve by the Cardinals on Tuesday, Darren Urban of the team's official website reports.

injuries.longComment: Ojulari has been working his way back from a torn ACL that he suffered in training camp in 2024, and he will now be forced to miss at least four games to open the 2025 season. In his absence, Baron Browning will operate as the primary backup option behind Zaven Collins at strongside linebacker.
injuries.shortComment: Ojulari (knee) was moved to the reserve/PUP list by the Cardinals on Tuesday, Darren Urban of the team's official website reports.

injuries.longComment: Johnson went down with a groin injury in the second half Sunday, ultimately not returning to the game as a result. The cornerback's status at practice will be worth monitoring as the Cardinals gear up to face the 49ers on the road in Week 3.
injuries.shortComment: Johnson (groin) suffered a groin injury in Sunday's 27-22 win over the Panthers, Tyler Drake of ArizonaSports.com reports.

injuries.longComment: It's still not fully clear what happened, but the update sheds some light on the circumstances surrounding the unusual development for Murphy-Bunting. He'll now have to begin rehabbing from the procedure, and in the meantime, his absence will force Arizona to lean more heavily on 2025 second-rounder Will Johnson and 2024 second-rounder Max Melton.
injuries.shortComment: Coach Jonathan Gannon said Wednesday that Murphy-Bunting underwent surgery on his knee to address the injury that landed him on Arizona's NFI list, Josh Weinfuss of ESPN.com reports.

injuries.longComment: Blount was originally ruled out for the remainder of Arizona's Week 1 win due to a concussion, but it now appears he also sustained a neck injury serious enough to end his 2025 campaign. The 27-year-old from Virginia has appeared in 27 games for the Cardinals over the past three seasons, recording 12 total tackles as a key special-teamer. With Blount out for the year, Kitan Crawford could see additional reps as a rotational safety as the season progresses.
injuries.shortComment: Head coach Jonathan Gannon told reporters Wednesday that Blount (neck/concussion) will be placed on injured reserve and miss the remainder of the season, Josh Weinfuss of ESPN.com reports.

injuries.longComment: Melton was carted to the locker room with a knee injury in the first half, and his day has now officially come to a premature end. The cornerback compiled two solo tackles before his departure, and in his place, Denzel Burke will likely continue to see an increase in workload in Arizona's secondary.
injuries.shortComment: Melton (knee) has been ruled out for the rest of Sunday's contest against the Panthers, Theo Mackie of The Arizona Republic reports.

injuries.longComment: Thomas was coming off a strong season during which he recorded 47 tackles (31 solo) across 17 games played but will now be forced to miss the entirety of the upcoming campaign after tearing his ACL during practice Friday. Max Melton and Will Johnson will now likely serve as the team's starting outside cornerbacks during the 2025 season.
injuries.shortComment: The Cardinals placed Thomas (knee) on injured reserve Sunday.

injuries.longComment: Williams collided with teammate Budda Baker in the end zone with less than two minutes remaining in the game, ultimately exiting the contest thereafter. The cornerback did not return to the field, and his status will be worth monitoring at practice in the coming days ahead of the team's matchup with the 49ers in Week 3.
injuries.shortComment: Williams suffered a left knee injury in Sunday's 27-22 win over the Panthers, Bo Brack of GoPHNX.com reports.

injuries.longComment: Jackson suffered the thumb injury in Saturday's preseason opener against the Chiefs and will now miss the 2025 season unless the Cardinals cut him with an injury settlement at a later date. Jackson played six offensive snaps versus Kansas City and failed to catch his lone target.
injuries.shortComment: The Cardinals placed Jackson (thumb) on injured reserve Tuesday.

injuries.longComment: Senn signed a contract with the Cardinals in May as an undrafted free agent following a collegiate career at Colorado and UConn. The offensive lineman will now be forced to miss the entirety of the 2025 campaign while on IR, unless he's able to come to an agreement on an injury settlement with Arizona.
injuries.shortComment: Senn (undisclosed) was placed on injured reserve by the Cardinals on Sunday, Aaron Wilson of KPRC 2 Houston reports.

injuries.longComment: The rookie sixth-round pick made the 53-man roster but will miss at least four games due to his placement on injured reserve. Conner will likely serve in a reserve role upon return.
injuries.shortComment: Conner (knee) was placed on injured reserve Tuesday.

injuries.longComment: questionable
injuries.shortComment: questionable

injuries.longComment: Jones will miss at least four games after picking up a knee injury in the preseason opener. The 2024 fifth-round pick started one game as a rookie and is expected to be a reserve member upon return.
injuries.shortComment: Jones (knee) was placed on injured reserve Tuesday.

injuries.longComment: questionable
injuries.shortComment: questionable

injuries.longComment: questionable
injuries.shortComment: questionable

injuries.longComment: Aumavae is still recovering from the Achilles tear he suffered last July. The Oregon product was waived by Carolina on Thursday, and since he's cleared waivers, he'll now move to the team's injured reserve.
injuries.shortComment: Aumavae (Achilles) cleared waivers and reverted to injured reserve Friday, Aaron Wilson of KPRC 2 Houston reports.

injuries.longComment: Ray will spend a minimum of four games on IR as he works to recover from a mild high-ankle sprain suffered in mid-August. Once fully healthy, Ray is expected to contribute as a rotational defensive lineman for Carolina. He recorded 41 total tackles, including 1.0 sacks, across 16 regular-season games with the team in 2024.
injuries.shortComment: The Panthers placed Ray (ankle) on injured reserve Tuesday, which rules him out for at least the first four games of the regular season, Darin Gantt of the Panthers' official site reports.

injuries.longComment: Mathis suffered a torn ACL in practice Wednesday and will miss the duration of the 2025 season. He was a fourth-round pick by the Broncos in 2022 and appeared in 43 regular-season games with Denver the previous three seasons, making 18 starts.
injuries.shortComment: The Panthers placed Mathis (knee) on injured reserve Saturday.

injuries.longComment: Panthers head coach Dave Canales said Coker has a "serious quad strain," per Mike Kaye of The Charlotte Observer. While the second-year wideout's placement on IR allows him to retake the field after a minimum of only four games, it sounds like his return could be postponed until as late as Week 7 against the Jets on Sunday, Oct. 19. With Carolina also having traded Adam Thielen to Minnesota, the team inked veteran wideout Hunter Renfrow to the active roster Saturday to help provide depth behind Tetairoa McMillan (hamstring) and Xavier Legette.
injuries.shortComment: Coker (quadriceps), who was placed on IR on Saturday, is expected to be sidelined 4-to-6 games in his recovery, David Newton of ESPN reports.

injuries.longComment: Corbett suffered an MCL injury to his left knee during the Panthers' Week 2 loss to the Cardinals on Sunday. He'll be required to miss at least the next four games, though head coach Dave Canales said Monday that Corbett would be sidelined for longer -- perhaps the entire season -- were he to undergo surgery, per Gantt. Cade Mays will likely take over as the Panthers' starting center while Corbett is sidelined.
injuries.shortComment: The Panthers placed Corbett (knee) on injured reserve Tuesday, Darin Gantt of the team's official site reports.

injuries.longComment: A stint on injured reserve requires a player to miss at least the next four games, but Hunt will likely be out longer due to a torn biceps that he suffered during Sunday's loss to the Cardinals. Chandler Zavala is expected to start at right guard for as long as Hunt is out of action.
injuries.shortComment: The Panthers placed Hunt (biceps) on injured reserve Tuesday, Darin Gantt of the team's official site reports.

injuries.longComment: Players can return from the PUP list when placed on it at the start of training camp or before Week 1, but not if they get the designation this early in the offseason. Brooks tore the ACL in his right knee each of the past two years, bringing his college career to an early conclusion and then limiting his rookie season to three games. The Panthers took him in the second round of the 2024 NFL Draft, 46th overall, but they'll now move forward with Chuba Hubbard, Rico Dowdle and Trevor Etienne as the main candidates to take carries in 2025.
injuries.shortComment: The Panthers are placing Brooks on the physically unable to perform list, ruling him out for the entire 2025 season.

injuries.longComment: Per Matt McMullen of the Chiefs' official site, it's a broken foot that has landed Robinson on the Chiefs' IR during training camp. Due to the timing of the transaction, he's now in line to spend the entire 2025 season on injured reserve as he recovers.
injuries.shortComment: Kansas City placed Robinson (foot) on its injured reserve list Monday.

injuries.longComment: Danna exited the game in the first quarter. There is currently no timetable for his return, and Ashton Gillotte will take over Danna's spot on the defensive line in his absence.
injuries.shortComment: Danna (hip) is questionable to return to Kansas City's matchup versus the Eagles on Sunday.

injuries.longComment: The defensive end suffered the injury during Friday's preseason loss to the Seahawks. A first-round pick in 2023, Anudike-Uzomah has recorded just 3.0 sacks and three starts across 34 regular-season contests, and now, his immediate availability is in doubt. If he's able to return, he should again play a depth role for the Chiefs.
injuries.shortComment: Anudike-Uzomah (hamstring) was placed on injured reserve by the Chiefs on Monday.

injuries.longComment: George agreed to a contract with the Chiefs as an undrafted free agent this offseason, but the rookie linebacker will miss the entire 2025 campaign after being placed on injured reserve with an undisclosed injury. The Pittsburgh product will now focus on his recovery before getting his next opportunity to take the field in 2026.
injuries.shortComment: George (undisclosed) was placed on injured reserve Tuesday.

injuries.longComment: Johnson suffered a shoulder injury in the Chiefs' second preseason game against the Seahawks. By being placed on injured reserve with a designation to return, the 27-year-old cornerback will be required to miss at least the first four games of the 2025 campaign. Johnson will likely return to his rotational role in Kansas City's defensive backfield once he's healthy.
injuries.shortComment: Johnson (shoulder) was placed on injured reserve Tuesday with a designation to return.

injuries.longComment: Scott was waived with an injury designation Friday due to an undisclosed injury, but he is now in line to miss the entire 2025 season while on IR with the Chiefs. The cornerback will need to reach an injury settlement with the team in order to potentially play this year.
injuries.shortComment: Scott (undisclosed) reverted to injured reserve with Kansas City on Saturday, Aaron Wilson of KPRC 2 Houston reports.

injuries.longComment: This move was inevitable after Bush tore his left Achilles tendon in Saturday's preseason loss to Denver. The veteran safety will miss the entire 2025 campaign but has a chance of being ready for the 2026 season.
injuries.shortComment: The Chiefs placed Bush (Achilles) on injured reserve Monday.

injuries.longComment: Fulton was tagged as doubtful to return after suffering an ankle injury in the first quarter, and the 2020 second-rounder will be sidelined for the rest of Sunday's contest. Nohl Williams will work in rotation with starters Jaylen Watson and Trent McDuffie due to Fulton's injury.
injuries.shortComment: Fulton (ankle) has been ruled out for the rest of Sunday's game against the Eagles.

injuries.longComment: questionable
injuries.shortComment: questionable

injuries.longComment: questionable
injuries.shortComment: questionable

injuries.longComment: Rice's suspension will begin immediately, as he and the NFL reached an agreement Wednesday on an arrangement that will force him to miss the first six weeks of the regular season but allow him to retake the field mid-season. He will first be eligible for reinstatement and to resume practicing Oct. 13 and to make his regular-season debut in Week 7 versus the Raiders on Oct. 19. JuJu Smith-Schuster figures to join Xavier Worthy and Hollywood Brown (ankle) in the majority of three-wide sets until Rice is reinstated.
injuries.shortComment: The NFL officially suspended Rice for the first six games of the 2025 regular season Wednesday for violating the league's Personal Conduct Policy, Ian Rapoport of NFL Network reports.

injuries.longComment: Driskell has continued to work his way back from an appendectomy throughout the majority of training camp. The 25-year-old offensive lineman will now be forced to miss the first four games of the 2025 season as he continues to recover.
injuries.shortComment: Driskell (appendix) was placed on the reserve/non-football injury list Tuesday.

injuries.longComment: Briningstool has been working through a hamstring injury since the start of training camp, and the issue is severe enough for him to start the season on IR. He'll be required to miss the first four games of the regular season, making Week 5 against the Jaguars on Monday, Oct. 6 his first opportunity to make his 2025 debut. Briningstool signed with the Chiefs in late April as an undrafted free agent following a four-year college career at Clemson.
injuries.shortComment: The Chiefs placed Briningstool (hamstring) on injured reserve Tuesday with a designation to return, per the NFL's transaction log.

injuries.longComment: The Chiefs waived Ingram with an injury designation Thursday, and after clearing waivers, the 25-year-old was placed on IR. The USC product got into just one game for Kansas City last season, logging five special-teams snaps and no offensive snaps. Ingram will miss the 2025 campaign unless he works out an injury settlement with the Chiefs.
injuries.shortComment: Ingram (undisclosed) reverted to injured reserve Friday, Aaron Wilson of KPRC 2 Houston reports.

injuries.longComment: Dean will be forced to miss at least the first four games of the 2025 campaign as he continues his recovery from the torn left patellar tendon he sustained in the Eagles' wild-card win over the Packers in January. The 24-year-old took a massive step forward in his third NFL season, compiling 128 total tackles (80 solo), including 3.0 sacks, while also adding an interception, a forced fumble and two fumble recoveries over 15 regular-season contests in 2024. Once healthy, Dean figures to start alongside Zack Baun at interior linebacker.
injuries.shortComment: Dean (knee) was moved to the reserve/PUP list Tuesday.

injuries.longComment: questionable
injuries.shortComment: questionable

injuries.longComment: The second-year wideout suffered a season-ending injury to his left knee during practice Tuesday. Wilson previously appeared on track for a depth role, likely standing fourth or fifth on the depth chart at wide receiver. His injury gives recent trade acquisition John Metchie a better chance to make the Week 1 roster.
injuries.shortComment: The Eagles placed Wilson (knee) on injured reserve Friday, Jeff McLane of The Philadelphia Inquirer reports.

injuries.longComment: A sixth-round rookie out of Michigan, Hinton dealt with a myriad of injuries during college, but it's unclear what's holding him out now. Hinton will be required to miss at least four games to begin the season. Once he's cleared, he'll likely land in a reserve role.
injuries.shortComment: Hinton (undisclosed) was placed on injured reserve Tuesday.

injuries.longComment: Lampkin was claimed off waivers by the Eagles from the Rams on Wednesday, and the undrafted rookie will start the regular season on injured reserve due to a leg injury that he suffered in the preseason. He'll be forced to miss at least the first four games of the year, which makes Week 5 against the Broncos on Sunday, Oct. 5, the earliest he's eligible to return.
injuries.shortComment: The Eagles placed Lampkin (leg) on injured reserve Friday.

injuries.longComment: Williams already missed the team's Week 1 victory over the Cowboys and will now be sidelined for at least another four games. He was selected by Philadelphia in the sixth round of this year's draft and will look to make his regular-season debut as a backup tackle once healthy.
injuries.shortComment: The Eagles placed Williams (shoulder) on injured reserve Saturday.

injuries.longComment: questionable
injuries.shortComment: questionable

injuries.longComment: questionable
injuries.shortComment: questionable

injuries.longComment: questionable
injuries.shortComment: questionable

injuries.longComment: VanSumeren suffered the injury on the opening kickoff of Philadelphia's Week 1 matchup against the Cowboys. He was placed on injured reserve earlier Friday and will be sidelined for the rest of the season.
injuries.shortComment: VanSumeren was diagnosed with a torn patella tendon Friday, Adam Schefter of ESPN reports.

injuries.longComment: Williams wasn't picked up by another club after Minnesota waived him with an injury designation Thursday, so he's now going on the team's injured-reserve list. He'll spend the entire season there unless the two parties reach an injury settlement.
injuries.shortComment: Williams (undisclosed) reverted to the Vikings' injured-reserve list Friday, Aaron Wilson of KPRC 2 Houston reports.

injuries.longComment: Batty secured a spot on the 53-man roster as an undrafted free agent out of BYU, but he'll be required to miss at least the first four games before touching the NFL field. Through 13 games during his fifth season at BYU, Batty posted 33 tackles (26 solo), 1.5 sacks and two interceptions.
injuries.shortComment: Batty (knee) was placed on injured reserve Tuesday.

injuries.longComment: questionable
injuries.shortComment: questionable

injuries.longComment: Cashman sustained a hamstring injury in Minnesota's Week 1 win over Chicago. The earliest he can return from IR would be Week 7 against the Eagles, following Minnesota's Week 6 bye. Eric Wilson is expected to start in Cashman's absence. Cashman missed at least three games due to injuries in five of his previous six NFL seasons and will do so again in 2025.
injuries.shortComment: Cashman (hamstring) was placed on injured reserve Thursday.

injuries.longComment: questionable
injuries.shortComment: questionable

injuries.longComment: questionable
injuries.shortComment: questionable

injuries.longComment: questionable
injuries.shortComment: questionable

injuries.longComment: The kickoff return man sustained a knee injury in the season opener against Chicago and will be out through Minnesota's Week 6 bye as a result of Thursday's move. Rookies Myles Price (knee) and Tai Felton are the top candidates to return kicks in Chandler's absence, with Price favored to get those opportunities if healthy after a strong debut on special teams.
injuries.shortComment: Chandler (knee) was placed on injured reserve Thursday.

injuries.longComment: Addison appeared to hurt his hand or arm Wednesday, resulting in him spending the rest of practice off the field as an observer. That he's avoided any sort of serious issue is an especially positive development considering that both Justin Jefferson (hamstring) and Jalen Nailor (hand) currently are nursing injuries of their own. Jefferson, at least, returned to practice Monday and has begun ramping up his activity level with the goal of being fully healthy for Week 1 against the Bears on Monday, Sept. 8. Addison, for his part, will miss time early in the regular season due to his three-game suspension, though he'll be allowed to suit up for Friday's preseason finale against the Titans if coach Kevin O'Connell decides to play his starters.
injuries.shortComment: Addison (suspension) did not sustain a significant injury upon departing Wednesday's practice early and will have no limitations going forward, Kevin Seifert of ESPN.com reports.

injuries.longComment: Moore suffered a season-ending knee injury for the second summer in a row, after missing all of 2024 while with the Falcons. He's scheduled for free agency again next offseason but will first face a lengthy rehab process before he can attempt to resume his career in 2026.
injuries.shortComment: The Vikings placed Moore (knee) on injured reserve Tuesday.

injuries.longComment: questionable
injuries.shortComment: questionable

injuries.longComment: Skule is the second offensive lineman to be placed in concussion protocol Sunday, joining center Ryan Kelly, who was ruled out after halftime. Walter Rouse has taken over at left tackle in place on Skule versus Atlanta.
injuries.shortComment: Skule (concussion) has been ruled out for the rest of Sunday night's contest against the Falcons, Kevin Seifert of ESPN.com reports.

injuries.longComment: Kelly suffered a blow to the head in the first half against Atlanta, and it's unclear if he'll be able to return to the contest. Michael Jurgens has taken over at center in Kelly's absence.
injuries.shortComment: Kelly (head) is being evaluated for a concussion during Sunday night's contest against the Falcons, Kevin Seifert of ESPN.com reports.

injuries.longComment: Correll fractured his ankle during the Vikings' preseason win against the Texans on Saturday. He was initially waived with an injury designation but reverted to the Vikings' IR after going unclaimed. Correll will be forced to miss the whole 2025 season unless he reaches an injury settlement with Minnesota.
injuries.shortComment: Correll (ankle) reverted to the Vikings' injured reserve list Wednesday, Aaron Wilson of KPRC 2 Houston reports.

injuries.longComment: Nelson signed with Minnesota in July, but he's now set to miss the entirety of the 2025 campaign while sidelined with an undisclosed injury. The offensive lineman would only be eligible to return to action this season if he's able to reach an injury settlement with the Vikings.
injuries.shortComment: Nelson (undisclosed) was placed on the Vikings' injured reserve Monday.

injuries.longComment: The Vikings haven't provided an official timeline for McCarthy's return from the injury, but Carson Wentz will be in line to start at quarterback for at least this Sunday's game against the Bengals. Schefter notes that because the Vikings are playing overseas Weeks 4 (Sept. 28 versus the Steelers in Dublin) and 5 (Oct. 5 versus the Browns in London) before heading into a bye Week 6, the team could be inclined to err on the side of caution and hold McCarthy out for the next three games to give him sufficient time to heal up from the ankle injury.
injuries.shortComment: McCarthy (ankle) is expected to miss 2-to-4 weeks after sustaining a right high-ankle sprain in Sunday's 22-6 loss to the Falcons, Adam Schefter of ESPN reports.

injuries.longComment: The rookie sixth-round pick out of Pittsburgh missed the entire training camp and will now sit out at least four games. Bartholomew put together a solid collegiate career but never surpassed 326 yards or four touchdowns in a season. Once he returns, he'll look to usurp undrafted rookie Benjamin Yurosek for the No. 3 tight end job.
injuries.shortComment: Bartholomew (back) was placed on the reserve/PUP list Tuesday.

injuries.longComment: Head coach Kevin O'Connell had already indicated that Jones was on track to sit out Sunday's game against the Bengals after straining his hamstring in the Week 2 loss to the Falcons, but the veteran running back will now have to miss at least four games while he heads to IR. Minnesota added Cam Akers to its practice squad Tuesday to bolster its backfield depth, but Jordan Mason looks set to operate as the Vikings' clear No. 1 running back in Jones' absence. Over the first two games of the season, Jones had been part of a timeshare with Mason, playing fewer than half the offensive snaps in both contests while carrying 13 times for 46 yards and adding three catches for 44 yards and a touchdown on four targets.
injuries.shortComment: The Vikings plan to place Jones (hamstring) on injured reserve Tuesday, Tom Pelissero of NFL Network reports.

injuries.longComment: The kickoff return man sustained a knee injury in the season opener against Chicago and will be out through Minnesota's Week 6 bye as a result of Thursday's move. Rookies Myles Price (knee) and Tai Felton are the top candidates to return kicks in Chandler's absence, with Price favored to get those opportunities if healthy after a strong debut on special teams.
injuries.shortComment: Chandler (knee) was placed on injured reserve Thursday.

injuries.longComment: Ham underwent ankle surgery in February, and it's unclear if this injury is related. Regardless, Ham will miss at least four games to start the year. The Vikings don't have another fullback on the roster, so their scheme may need to be altered in the short term.
injuries.shortComment: Ham (undisclosed) was placed on injured reserve Tuesday.

injuries.longComment: The nature and severity of Graham's injury isn't clear, but the 2021 fifth-rounder will be required to miss at least the first four games of the season. His first chance to make his 2025 regular-season debut will be Week 6 against the Bills on Monday, Oct. 13.
injuries.shortComment: The Falcons placed Graham (undisclosed) on injured reserve Tuesday with a designation to return, Terrin Waack, Will McFadden and Tori McElhaney of the team's official site report.

injuries.longComment: Andersen started camp on the physically unable to perform list while continuing to recover from a knee injury that caused him to land on IR in December. The move to the reserve/PUP list means the 2022 second-rounder will be forced to miss at least the first four games of the regular season, making Week 6 against the Bills on Monday, Oct. 13 the first opportunity for him to make his 2025 regular-season debut. Andersen has served in a rotational role at inside linebacker over his first three NFL seasons, so JD Bertrand, DeAngelo Malone and Josh Woods are all candidates to see increased snaps on defense behind starters Kaden Elliss and Divine Deablo due to Andersen's injury.
injuries.shortComment: The Falcons placed Anderson on the reserve/PUP list Tuesday, Terrin Waack, Will McFadden and Tori McElhaney of the team's official site report.

injuries.longComment: Head coach Raheem Morris told reporters Thursday that Trice aggravated the same knee that kept him sidelined for the entire 2024 season. While there's hope that Trice can return after the Week 5 bye, Morris noted that a procedure on the knee might be needed, and that decision will be discussed over the coming days, per McElhaney.
injuries.shortComment: The Falcons placed Trice (knee) on injured reserve Thursday, Tori McElhaney of the team's official site reports.

injuries.longComment: Terrell suffered a hamstring injury in the first half, and he will now be forced to sit out the rest of Sunday Night Football. In his place, Natrone Brooks and Dee Alford have seen an increase in snaps in the secondary.
injuries.shortComment: Terrell (hamstring) has been ruled out for the rest of Sunday night's game against Minnesota, Tori McElhaney of the Falcons' official site reports.

injuries.longComment: Verdon missed all of training camp due to an undisclosed issue. By starting the season on the NFI list, he'll be forced to miss at least the first four games of the regular season, making Week 6 against the Bills on Monday, Oct. 13 the earliest he can return.
injuries.shortComment: The Falcons moved Verdon to the reserve/non-football injury list Tuesday, Terrin Waack, Will McFadden and Tori McElhaney of the team's official site report.

injuries.longComment: The 27-year-old safety had already been ruled out for the Falcons' Week 2 matchup against the Vikings due to a knee injury, but the issue now appears serious enough to land him on IR. Fuller played 17 total snaps (one defensive and 16 on special teams) in the Week 1 loss to the Buccaneers, failing to record a stat. With Fuller now sidelined, Xavier Watts and Jessie Bates are currently the only safeties on the Falcons' active roster without injury designations.
injuries.shortComment: Fuller (knee) was placed on injured reserve Saturday, Terrin Waack of the Falcons' official site reports.

injuries.longComment: questionable
injuries.shortComment: questionable

injuries.longComment: questionable
injuries.shortComment: questionable

injuries.longComment: questionable
injuries.shortComment: questionable

injuries.longComment: questionable
injuries.shortComment: questionable

injuries.longComment: Norton was placed on injured reserve last week and seems likely to miss more than the required four games to begin the regular season. He's recovering from surgery on the injured ankle. Norton's absence became more notable after the Falcons lost starting RT Kaleb McGary (leg) for the duration of the 2025 season. Veteran Elijah Wilkinson is expected to open the season at right tackle -- lefty Michael Penix's blind side -- for Atlanta, which represents a significant downgrade from McGary.
injuries.shortComment: Norton (ankle) is expected to be sidelined six-to-eight weeks, D. Orlando Ledbetter of the Atlanta Journal Constitution reports.

injuries.longComment: ir
injuries.shortComment: ir

injuries.longComment: questionable
injuries.shortComment: questionable

injuries.longComment: Atlanta didn't designate McGary to return, meaning the left leg injury that caused him to be carted off the practice field Aug. 21 will force him to miss the entire 2025 season. The loss of their starting right tackle is a huge blow to the Falcons' offense, and could impact the fantasy upside of quarterback Michael Penix and running back Bijan Robinson. Elijah Wilkinson appears the most likely candidate to step into the vacant starting role, though Jack Nelson and Brandon Parker could also get opportunities.
injuries.shortComment: The Falcons placed McGary on season-ending IR on Tuesday, Mike Garafolo of NFL Network reports.

injuries.longComment: Jones was waived with an injury designation by Atlanta on Monday, and he'll now spend the 2025 season on injured reserve unless the Falcons later cut the quarterback with an injury settlement.
injuries.shortComment: Jones (concussion) reverted to injured reserve after clearing waivers Tuesday, Aaron Wilson of KPRC 2 Houston reports.

injuries.longComment: Autry played through a knee injury for most of 2024, so his placement on the active/PUP list to begin training camp was viewed as a precaution. However, he'll now be forced to remain sidelined for at least the first four games of the regular season.
injuries.shortComment: Autry (knee) was placed on the reserve/PUP list Tuesday.

injuries.longComment: Per Aaron Wilson of KPRC 2 Houston, Hamilton's recent surgery to repair a broken ankle was successful, and he'll need around four months to recover. Due to the timing of his placement on IR, it's unlikely he'll get a chance to play again until 2026.
injuries.shortComment: Houston placed Hamilton (ankle) on its injured reserve list Friday.

injuries.longComment: Hinish re-signed with the Texans in the offseason, but he'll be forced to sit out the start of training camp as a result of an undisclosed injury. The defensive lineman can return to practice and play at any point in the preseason.
injuries.shortComment: Hinish (undisclosed) was placed on the active/PUP list by the Texans on Wednesday.

injuries.longComment: Reed has been recovering well from the sprained knee he suffered in early August, per Aaron Wilson of KPRC 2 Houston, but he will now be forced to miss at least four games to open the 2025 campaign. The rookie was competing for a depth role at strong safety behind starter Calen Bullock, and Russ Yeast sticks out as the most likely candidate to handle the No. 2 role for the time being.
injuries.shortComment: Reed (ankle) was placed on injured reserve with a designation to return Tuesday.

injuries.longComment: Ward will not be eligible to participate in practice or attend regular-season games until such time as he's brought off the Commissioner Exempt List. He may face league discipline relating to a pair of offseason arrests, the original of which, third-degree felony domestic violence charges, occurred in June. Ward is also recovering from foot surgery and isn't yet ready to practice were he eligible to do so, per Aaron Wilson of KPRC 2 Houston.
injuries.shortComment: The Texans placed Ward (undisclosed) on the Commissioner Exempt List on Tuesday, Tom Pelissero of NFL Network reports.

injuries.longComment: Huzzie will miss the first four games of the regular season due to this move. The undrafted rookie out of North Carolina was first reported as injured in July after signing with Houston in May.
injuries.shortComment: Huzzie (undisclosed) was placed on the reserve/non-football injury list Tuesday.

injuries.longComment: Berrios missed the first two games of the regular season due to a hamstring injury, but he is trending towards making his 2025 regular-season debut Sunday. The 2018 sixth-rounder signed a one-year contract with the Texans in March after spending the last two seasons with the Dolphins. When he does take the field, Berrios projects to serve in a rotational role on kickoff and punt returns and as a depth piece at wide receiver.
injuries.shortComment: Head coach DeMeco Ryans said Tuesday that he expects Berrios (hamstring) to be available for the Texans' Week 3 AFC South clash against the Jaguars on Sunday, Aaron Wilson of KPRC 2 Houston reports.

injuries.longComment: Acquired from the Jaguars in March, Kirk missed the Texans' first two games of the season while he recovered from a hamstring injury, which has kept him from practicing since the end of the preseason. The veteran wideout's condition appears to have improved during his time off, but Kirk will still likely need to upgrade to full participation in practice by Friday in order to receive clearance to play against one of his former teams. The potential return of Kirk to the lineup Sunday could help bolster a Texans passing attack that ranks 28th in the NFL with an average of 166.5 yards per game through the first two weeks.
injuries.shortComment: Texans head coach DeMeco Ryans said Tuesday that he anticipates Kirk (hamstring) making his team debut Sunday in Jacksonville, DJ Bien-Aime of ESPN.com reports.

injuries.longComment: Berrios missed the first two games of the regular season due to a hamstring injury, but he is trending towards making his 2025 regular-season debut Sunday. The 2018 sixth-rounder signed a one-year contract with the Texans in March after spending the last two seasons with the Dolphins. When he does take the field, Berrios projects to serve in a rotational role on kickoff and punt returns and as a depth piece at wide receiver.
injuries.shortComment: Head coach DeMeco Ryans said Tuesday that he expects Berrios (hamstring) to be available for the Texans' Week 3 AFC South clash against the Jaguars on Sunday, Aaron Wilson of KPRC 2 Houston reports.

injuries.longComment: Berrios missed the first two games of the regular season due to a hamstring injury, but he is trending towards making his 2025 regular-season debut Sunday. The 2018 sixth-rounder signed a one-year contract with the Texans in March after spending the last two seasons with the Dolphins. When he does take the field, Berrios projects to serve in a rotational role on kickoff and punt returns and as a depth piece at wide receiver.
injuries.shortComment: Head coach DeMeco Ryans said Tuesday that he expects Berrios (hamstring) to be available for the Texans' Week 3 AFC South clash against the Jaguars on Sunday, Aaron Wilson of KPRC 2 Houston reports.
